description: From Latin topia, from Ancient Greek τόπια (tópia), ultimately from Ancient Greek τόπος (tópos, “place”).

entries.meaning: (historical) A kind of mural decoration common in Ancient Roman houses, usually featuring landscapes.

description: From Ancient Greek τόπος (tópos, “place, region”) + -ία (-ía), by analogy with utopia. Compare also French topie.

entries.meaning: (postmodern philosophy) The lived physical place, in opposition to the ideal of a utopia.
